definition: abrupt or offhand in speech or manner
examples: she could be brusque and impatient

definition: not easily upset or excited
examples: a placid, contented man

definition: (especially of an argument, story, or sentence) extremely complex and difficult to follow
examples: the film is let down by a convoluted plot in which nothing really happens

definition: be a typical example of
examples: the best dry sherry is exemplified by the fino of Jerez

synonyms: serve as a typical example of

definition: a witty remark
examples: Peter ate heartily with a quip about being a condemned man

definition: make a witty remark
examples: ‘Flattery will get you nowhere,’ she quipped

definition: having or showing an irritable disposition
examples: a thin peevish voice

definition: cautious or wary due to realistic suspicions
examples: a city leery of gang violence

definition: painful or laborious effort
examples: advice for those who wish to save great sorrow and travail

definition: engage in painful or laborious effort
examples: creation may travail in pain but it cannot escape its destiny

definition: a tendency to be too ready to believe that something is real or true
examples: moneylenders prey upon their credulity and inexperience

definition: the action of reserving something
examples: the reservation of positions for non-Americans

definition: skill and sensitivity in dealing with others or with difficult issues
examples: the inspector broke the news to me with tact and consideration

definition: shrewd and knowledgeable; having common sense and good judgement
examples: many of us pride ourselves on being savvy enough to spot a fake
Bob is a savvy veteran who knows all the tricks

definition: shrewdness and practical knowledge; the ability to make good judgements
examples: the corporate finance bankers lacked the necessary political savvy

definition: know or understand
examples: I've been told, but I want to make sure. Savvy?
Charley would savvy what to do

definition: disagreement between people
examples: a prosperous family who showed no signs of discord

definition: (of people) disagree
examples: we discorded commonly on two points

definition: (of a fortified position) unable to be captured or broken into
examples: the seat I was offered appeared to be an impregnable Tory stronghold
a massive and impregnable fortress

definition: a pithy observation which contains a general truth
examples: the old aphorism ‘the child is father to the man’
the debate begins and ends at the level of aphorism, with commentators saying that something must be done

definition: having or showing care and conscientiousness in one's work or duties
examples: after diligent searching, he found a parcel

definition: stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or chosen course of action, despite attempts to persuade one to do so
examples: her obstinate determination to pursue a career in radio

definition: dullness of colour; loss of brightness.
lose or cause to lose lustre, especially as a result of exposure to air or moisture
examples: silver tarnishes too easily
lemon juice would tarnish the gilded metal

definition: a short, pithy statement expressing a general truth or rule of conduct
examples: the maxim that actions speak louder than words

definition: physically or mentally demanding
examples: they find the work too taxing

definition: a spiked stick used for driving cattle.
provoke or annoy (someone) so as to stimulate an action or reaction
examples: he was trying to goad her into a fight

definition: (of behaviour or actions) not proper or appropriate
examples: an unseemly squabble

definition: showing smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one's achievements
examples: you can't afford to be complacent about security

definition: resolutely or dutifully firm and unwavering
examples: steadfast loyalty

definition: make (something) more attractive by the addition of decorative details or features
examples: blue silk embellished with golden embroidery

definition: secret or illegal cooperation or conspiracy in order to deceive others
examples: the armed forces were working in collusion with drug traffickers

definition: an idea that is taken to be true on the basis of probability
examples: underlying presumptions about human nature

definition: having or showing a wish to do evil to others
examples: the glint of dark, malevolent eyes

definition: irritate; annoy
examples: it irks her to think of the runaround she received

definition: waste (something, especially money or time) in a reckless and foolish manner
examples: £100m of taxpayers' money has been squandered on administering the tax

definition: acting or done without careful consideration of the possible consequences; impetuous
examples: a rash decision
it would be extremely rash to make such an assumption

definition: an area of redness and spots on a person's skin, appearing especially as a result of illness
examples: a red itchy rash appeared on her legs
next day he broke out in a rash

definition: characterized by or causing cohesion
examples: each parish was formerly a cohesive unit
family life can be a cohesive force in society

definition: precede in time; come before (something) in date
examples: a civilization that antedated the Roman Empire

definition: a gum, spice, or other substance that is burned for the sweet smell it produces
examples: the sharp lingering sweetness of incense
incense sticks

definition: perfume with incense or a similar fragrance
examples: the aroma of cannabis incensed the air

definition: strange or mysterious, especially in an unsettling way
examples: an uncanny feeling that she was being watched

definition: dismiss (someone or something) as unimportant
examples: she belittled Amy's riding skills whenever she could

definition: occurring at irregular intervals; not continuous or steady
examples: intermittent rain

definition: (of a person or their behaviour) unconventional and slightly strange
examples: he noted her eccentric appearance

definition: a person of unconventional and slightly strange views or behaviour
examples: he's seen as a local eccentric

definition: (of a person or their behaviour) failing to observe the limits of what is permitted or appropriate
examples: I hope I won't be considered presumptuous if I offer some advice

definition: recklessly bold or rash
examples: it would be foolhardy to go into the scheme without support

definition: match or surpass (a person or achievement), typically by imitation
examples: most rulers wished to emulate Alexander the Great

definition: express contempt for; ridicule
examples: the decision was derided by environmentalists

definition: make (someone) annoyed or irritated
examples: he has been riled by suggestions that his Arsenal future is in doubt

definition: lacking flavour; weak or tasteless
examples: mugs of insipid coffee

definition: of the cerebrum of the brain
examples: a cerebral haemorrhage
the cerebral cortex

definition: a person sent or authorized to represent others, in particular an elected representative sent to a conference
examples: congress delegates rejected the proposals

definition: entrust (a task or responsibility) to another person, typically one who is less senior than oneself
examples: the power delegated to him must never be misused
she must delegate duties so as to free herself for more important tasks

definition: prove more powerful or superior
examples: it is hard for logic to prevail over emotion

definition: a structure of stone or brick built against a wall to strengthen or support it
examples: the cathedral's massive buttresses

definition: provide (a building or structure) with buttresses
examples: we buttressed the wall as it was showing signs of cracking and collapse

definition: come together to form one mass or whole
examples: the puddles had coalesced into shallow streams

definition: having or displaying a dashing, jaunty, or slightly disreputable quality or appearance
examples: he had a rakish, debonair look

definition: mercy; lenience
examples: an appeal for clemency

definition: lacking excitement or variety; boringly monotonous
examples: humdrum routine work

definition: monotonous routine
examples: an escape from the humdrum of his life

definition: a cause of great trouble or suffering
examples: the tribulations of being a megastar

definition: obtain by dishonest or devious means
examples: Ted attended all the football games he could finagle tickets for

definition: damage (someone's reputation)
examples: he had besmirched the good name of his family

definition: comparable in certain respects, typically in a way which makes clearer the nature of the things compared
examples: they saw the relationship between a ruler and his subjects as analogous to that of father and children

definition: a young deer in its first year
examples: a six-month-old roe fawn

definition: (of a deer) produce young
examples: the forest was closed for hunting when the does were fawning

definition: having or showing a tendency to be easily angered
examples: an irascible and difficult man

definition: a confusing and difficult problem or question
examples: one of the most difficult conundrums for the experts

definition: obtain (information) from various sources, often with difficulty
examples: the information is gleaned from press cuttings

definition: (of a cruel or violent action) deliberate and unprovoked
examples: sheer wanton vandalism

definition: a sexually unrestrained woman
examples: she'd behaved like a wanton

definition: play; frolic
examples: the sea breeze wantoned among the quivering leaves of the chestnut tree
they sat gazing at the white-flecked pure blue sea and the various gulls that wantoned in the wake

definition: remedy or compensation for a wrong or grievance
examples: those seeking redress for an infringement of public law rights

definition: remedy or set right (an undesirable or unfair situation)
examples: the power to redress the grievances of our citizens

definition: a thing implied.
show (someone) to be involved in a crime
examples: he implicated his government in the murders of three judges

definition: turn away (one's eyes or thoughts)
examples: she averted her eyes while we made stilted conversation

definition: envy (someone) the possession or enjoyment of (something)
examples: she begrudged Martin his affluence

definition: having a feeling of melancholy; sad and pensive
examples: she felt a little melancholy
a dark, melancholy young man with deep-set eyes

definition: a feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause
examples: he had an ability to convey a sense of deep melancholy and yearning through much of his work
an air of melancholy surrounded him
at the centre of his music lies a profound melancholy and nostalgia

definition: an abundance or large quantity of something
examples: a rich profusion of flowers
the beautiful pink foxgloves growing in profusion among the ferns

definition: not securely held or in position; dangerously likely to fall or collapse
examples: a precarious ladder

definition: make or declare (something, typically a church) sacred; dedicate formally to a religious purpose
examples: the present Holy Trinity church was consecrated in 1845

definition: (of a person or their manner or speech) direct and outspoken
examples: his most forthright attack yet on the reforms

definition: directly forwards.
diligent and hard-working
examples: an industrious people striving to make their country prosperous

definition: affected by lethargy; sluggish and apathetic
examples: I felt tired and a little lethargic

definition: ready to accept control or instruction; submissive
examples: a cheap and docile workforce
she's a black Labrador, gentle and docile

definition: showing a lack of proper concern; offhand
examples: Anne was irritated by his cavalier attitude

definition: a supporter of King Charles I in the English Civil War.
a thin decorative covering of fine wood applied to a coarser wood or other material
examples: the ceiling was of maple veneer
a fine-grained veneer

definition: cover (something) with a decorative layer of fine wood
examples: a veneered cabinet

definition: having a pleasantly sharp taste or appetizing flavour
examples: a piquant tartare sauce

definition: necessary for (someone) as a duty or responsibility
examples: the government realized that it was incumbent on them to act

definition: the holder of an office or post
examples: the present incumbent will soon be retiring

definition: regard something as being due to (a cause)
examples: he ascribed Jane's short temper to her upset stomach

definition: involving immoral or dishonourable actions and motives; arousing moral distaste and contempt
examples: the story paints a sordid picture of bribes and scams

definition: smelling very unpleasant
examples: leaking taps and malodorous drains

definition: a roughly squared timber beam
examples: a balk of timber

definition: hesitate or be unwilling to accept an idea or undertaking
examples: he balked at such a drastic solution

definition: including people from many different countries
examples: immigration transformed the city into a cosmopolitan metropolis

definition: a cosmopolitan person
examples: cosmopolitans who spoke both Spanish and English

definition: incapable of producing any useful result; pointless
examples: it is futile to allocate blame for this
a futile attempt to keep fans from mounting the stage

definition: tending to avoid commitment or self-revelation, especially by responding only indirectly
examples: she was evasive about her phone number

definition: extremely bad; appalling
examples: the quality of her work is abysmal

definition: (of a man or his behaviour) courteous and gallant, especially towards women
examples: shall I be chivalrous and offer you my coat?

definition: an act of resigning from a job or office
examples: he announced his resignation

definition: excellent
examples: ‘Thank ye, lad,’ the farmer said. ‘That's champion.’

definition: a person who has surpassed all rivals in a sporting contest or other competition
examples: a champion hurdler

definition: vigorously support or defend the cause of
examples: he championed the rights of the working class and the poor

definition: unable to express one's ideas or feelings clearly or easily
examples: an inarticulate man of action

synonyms: unable to get a word out

definition: careful and prudent in one's speech or actions, especially in order to keep something confidential or to avoid embarrassment
examples: we made some discreet inquiries

definition: the sending of someone or something to a destination or for a purpose
examples: a resolution authorizing the dispatch of a peacekeeping force

definition: send off to a destination or for a purpose
examples: the government dispatched 150 police to restore order
he dispatched messages back to base

definition: compete eagerly with someone in order to do or achieve something
examples: the athletes were vying for a place in the British team

definition: requiring considerable time and effort
examples: the work is very slow and laborious
years of laborious training

definition: a pithy observation which contains a general truth
examples: the old aphorism ‘the child is father to the man’
the debate begins and ends at the level of aphorism, with commentators saying that something must be done

definition: (of a performance, effort, or action) deserving public acknowledgement and praise but not necessarily outstanding or successful
examples: a very creditable 2–4 defeat

definition: prevent or hinder the progress of
examples: the changes must not be allowed to stymie new medical treatments

definition: a benefit which one enjoys or is entitled to on account of one's job or position
examples: the wife of a president has all the perquisites of stardom

definition: arranged or existing for the present, possibly to be changed later
examples: provisional bookings
a provisional government

definition: a provisional stamp.
a basket with a carrying handle and a hinged lid, used for food, cutlery, and plates on a picnic
examples: a picnic hamper

definition: hinder or impede the movement or progress of
examples: their work is hampered by lack of funds

definition: seemingly absurd or self-contradictory
examples: by glorifying the acts of violence they achieve the paradoxical effect of making them trivial

definition: intensely painful
examples: excruciating back pain

definition: defeat thoroughly
examples: he successfully vanquished his rival

definition: surround (a place) with armed forces in order to capture it or force its surrender
examples: the king marched north to besiege Berwick

definition: large or heavy and therefore difficult to carry or use; unwieldy
examples: cumbersome diving suits

definition: a limitation or restriction
examples: time constraints make it impossible to do everything
the availability of water is the main constraint on food production

definition: made up or consisting of several parts or elements
examples: a compound noun

definition: a thing that is composed of two or more separate elements; a mixture
examples: the air smelled like a compound of diesel and petrol fumes

definition: make up (a composite whole); constitute
examples: a dialect compounded of Spanish and Dutch

definition: willing to do a service or kindness; helpful
examples: it's very obliging of him
one of the most obliging stewards

definition: expose the falseness or hollowness of (an idea or belief)
examples: she debunks all the usual rubbish about acting

synonyms: drive a coach and horses through

definition: enough or more than enough; plentifully
examples: the persistent reader is amply rewarded

definition: done consciously and intentionally
examples: a deliberate attempt to provoke conflict

definition: engage in long and careful consideration
examples: she deliberated over the menu

definition: recognize or ascertain what makes (someone or something) different
examples: children can differentiate the past from the present

definition: extremely large or great
examples: a colossal amount of mail
a colossal mistake

definition: old-fashioned or outdated
examples: this antiquated central heating system

definition: assign an inferior rank or position to
examples: they aim to prevent women from being relegated to a secondary role

definition: an uneasy feeling of doubt, worry, or fear, especially about one's own conduct; a misgiving
examples: military regimes generally have no qualms about controlling the press

definition: relating to or characteristic of a misogynist
examples: a misogynist attitude

definition: a person who dislikes, despises, or is strongly prejudiced against women
examples: a bachelor and renowned misogynist

definition: sedate, respectable, and unadventurous
examples: staid law firms

definition: (of an atmosphere or event) friendly, lively, and enjoyable
examples: a convivial cocktail party

definition: the killing or destruction of a large proportion of a group or species
examples: the decimation of our rainforests

definition: a slight knowledge or suspicion; a hint
examples: the records give us an inkling of how people saw the world

definition: rough and bad-mannered; coarse
examples: boorish behaviour

definition: (of a person) behaving badly or unlawfully
examples: her miscreant husband

definition: a person who has done something wrong or unlawful
examples: the police are straining every nerve to bring the miscreants to justice

definition: an image that has been morphed.
change smoothly from one image to another by small gradual steps using computer animation techniques
examples: the characters can be morphed on screen

definition: (of a person's nose) short and turned up at the end
examples: snub-nosed

definition: an act of rebuffing or ignoring someone or something
examples: the move was a snub to the government

definition: rebuff, ignore, or spurn disdainfully
examples: they snubbed his invitation to a meeting of foreign ministers

definition: combining in such a way as to enhance or emphasize the qualities of each other or another
examples: the second TV network was complementary to the BBC
they had different but complementary skills

definition: difficult to please; critical
examples: she has silenced the carping critics with a successful debut tour

definition: (of a building or object) in a state of disrepair or ruin as a result of age or neglect
examples: old, dilapidated buildings

definition: mention (a number of things) one by one
examples: there is not space to enumerate all his works
